thread.title: Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino says it will only take a minute to tell if they can beat Gent
thread.title_full: Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino says it will only take a minute to tell if they can beat Gent

author: gsweet
title: Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino says it will only take a minute to tell if they can beat Gent
text:
The north Londoners must overturn a 1-0 deficit after stinking the place out in Belgium last week. 
Keep up to date with ALL the TOTTENHAM news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club pages plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The shock defeat surprised many but not Poch, who revealed he knows within a minute of kick-off if his Jekyll and Hyde stars are on their game. 
He said: “When we start a game, even if you only watch 50 seconds, you don’t have to be a genius to see we may struggle and will have some problems. 
“That’s what happened in the first leg, we weren’t focused. 
“At that precise moment it was too difficult to change, so we changed the formation at half- time to try to lift them but it was impossible. PA:Press Association Harry Kane twists and turns at the Tottenham training camp Getty Images All together now…Spurs players hop to it PA:Press Association 8 Under full control…Eric Dier is put through his paces 
“The problem is, when you start not in a good way, it’s too difficult to change that perception. 
“You give a very good signal to the opponent that you are not focused. You need to change that mentality. But, of course, you can detect it very early in a game.” Related Stories ROO CAN'T GO THERE Paul Scholes urges Wayne Rooney to resist financial temptation of China and go to Everton or MLS instead Mkhi taking St Etienne 0 Man United 1 (agg 0-4): Henrikh Mkhitaryan strike eases Red Devils through before limping off injured along with Michael Carrick Whatever it takes Die-hard Manchester United fan Rachel Riley cheers on team with cheeky off-camera TV set-up INSIDE the Countdown studio Guard down Liverpool handed major boost in pursuit of Joe Hart as Manchester City say he is available for £20m STAYING PUT Moussa Dembele to snub Chelsea, Arsenal and Real Madrid to see out four-year Celtic deal, according to agent DANCING QUEEN Elderly woman draws a crowd with Leicester fans in Seville by showing off her hilarious dance moves outside a packed bar Spurs’ Belgian midfielder Mousa Dembele claimed he felt his team underestimated Gent.
Pochettino said: “They did not surprise me last week. 
“We were poor, they were better than us and for that they won. 
“They did not surprise me because we watched many of their games and knew their quality. Getty Images Catch me if you can…Jan Vertonghen in full flow Reuters Boss Maurico Pochettino talks to his lieutenants 
“What surprised me was our performance — not their performance. 
“We are more aware of how they play and it’s up to us to show we deserve to go to the next round. 
“We need to be patient. That will be the key, to be aggressive and patient.” PA:Press Association Heads I win…Kane takes off Getty Images 8 Gent players go through their warm-up routine 
The clash is a 90,000 sell-out at Wembley, where a 1-0 victory after extra-time for Spurs will see the tie decided by penalties. 
But Pochettino revealed his men have not been practising them. Fulham 0-3 Tottenham : Harry Kane hat-trick fires Spurs into the FA Cup last eight He added: “You can shoot 100 penalties here at the training ground and score them all.
“But when you take the ball in front of 90,000 fans at Wembley, you will start to shake.” 
TOTTENHAM : Lloris, Trippier, Alderweireld, Vertonghen, Davies, Dier, Wanyama, Eriksen, Alli, Dembele, Kane.
